paper_abstract: The Williams and Otto Chemical Plant is a classic example of a complex nonlinear programming problem incorporating the essential features of a chemical or hydrometallurgical processing plant. An efficient solution strategy for this time tested problem is shown here which uses different variants of biologically inspired Genetic Algorithms and is aided by a multiobjective formulation. The Genetic Algorithms worked more efficiently than the classical techniques used earlier and the nature of the feasible solutions was clearly revealed by the Pareto-optimality concept embedded in the multi-objective optimization employed here. (C) 2005 Elsevier B. V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: The Williams and Otto Chemical Plant re-evaluated using a Pareto-optimal formulation aided by Genetic Algorithms
